revised_title: Observations of Sunspots by Flamstead and Halley in 1676
tldr: Mr. Flamstead and Mr. Edmund Halley observed and recorded the movement and characteristics of sunspots in July and August 1676. Their findings suggest that the sun's axis was inclined to the plane of the Orbis Magnus, and they provide estimates for the nodes of the sun's equinox and ecliptic.
